title: The State of Airline Retailing
excerpt: A global survey of 105 airline professionals reveals a sobering truth: not a single respondent thinks airlines are doing a 'very good job' at retailing.
author: Retailaer
content:
From our reading list: When Ann Cederhall and Airline Information surveyed 105 airline professionals worldwide, the results confirmed what we've seen across the industry: airlines know they need to do better at retailing, but most lack the systems to make it happen. This white paper should be required reading for any airline executive.

The Headline Finding

Not a single survey respondent expressed the belief that airlines were doing a "very good job" at retailing. Just 14% of participants stated that airlines were doing a "good job."

The Technology Gap

  • 62% said their airline does not utilize an Offer and Order Management System
  • 64% said they are unable to sell partner ancillaries

Where Airlines Are Focusing

The survey highlighted that airlines are concentrating efforts on leveraging customer experience to drive revenues. Almost half (47%) of respondents indicated they are using their loyalty program to create personalized offers to customers.

The Opportunity Ahead

As Ann Cederhall notes: "The opportunity that airlines have to create amazing customer experiences and lifelong loyal customers is so unbelievably huge that I believe we're on the cusp of a massive airline industry transformation that will put the customer front and centre once again."

This is exactly what Retailaer was built to enable—helping airlines unlock their retail potential through customer-first offer and order management.
